column4: I'm running Xchat, and cannot figure out how to erase old chatlogs.  any help is appreciated
they are all just put in a big file, just delete them or trim them down or something
I wish there was an option to disable or enable human readable format but there doesnt appear to be one
ty, but how do I do that?
I know they are all in one big file
do you know how many lines you want to trim out?
you could just do
yes, all of them
or most of them
if you want to blast them, just delete the log file
xchat will create a new one
I can't seem to find the delete
if you want to selectively delete blocks, I can give you a sed command that can do it
rm ~/.xchat/whereverthelogis
I can I suppose highlight them and try my delete button
the log files are named
along the lines of server-#channel or something
for example
if I was to delete my #ubuntu log
I would execute the command
rm ~/.xchat2/xchatlogs/Ubuntuserver-#ubuntu.log
change the filename that fits your configuration
ty, from the 'terminal'  is there an equivalant to the DOS  dotprompt?
what?
